Class DPostDeclaration

  • java.lang.Object
    • DPostDeclaration
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Initiator, Terminator

    public abstract class DPostDeclaration
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an abstract class to represent the DPost declarations.
    Author:
    Albex

    • Constructor Detail

      • DPostDeclaration

        protected DPostDeclaration(Predicate event,
                Predicate fluent,
                java.lang.Integer[] linkedVariables,
                Predicate condition)
        Constructor of the object.
        Parameters:
        event - is the general form of event (with often free variables).
        fluent - is also the general form fluent. It is the terminated or created by the event.
        linkedVariables - mapped the fluent variables to the event ones to link variables and pass their values.
        condition - is the condition to be satisfied before performing the effect of the event.

    • Method Detail

      • getEvent

        public Predicate getEvent()
        Getter method for the event attribute.
        Returns:
        the event contained in the declaration.

      • getFluent

        public Predicate getFluent()
        Getter method for the fluent attribute.
        Returns:
        the fluent contained in the declaration.

      • getCondition

        public Predicate getCondition()
        Getter method for the condition attribute.
        Returns:
        the condition to be satisfied before performing the effect of the event.

      • getGroundFluent

        public Predicate getGroundFluent(Predicate event)
        This method is used to apply certain values to the variable of the event and to pass these values to the fluent according to the linked variables.
        Parameters:
        event - is an external event defined by this declaration.
        Returns:
        a fluent with all the values needed according to the linked variables.

        public abstract java.lang.String toString()
        Abstract method to implement in subclasses.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
